item.title: 新加坡律师事务所将就亚洲在 AT1 上的损失起诉瑞士
item.description: 新加坡最大的律师事务所之一将在今年年底前向瑞士政府提出索赔，为数百名持有瑞士信贷AT1债务的亚洲债券持有人寻求赔偿。【原文：One of Singapore’s biggest law firms is set to file claims against the Swiss government by the end of the year, seeking compensation for hundreds of Asian bondholders of Credit Suisse AT1 debt that was wiped out in 2023.】

item.title: 中国称发现美国对国家机构进行网络攻击的证据
item.description: 中国说，它发现了美国政府对中国负责计时的主要机构进行网络攻击的 "无可辩驳的证据"。【原文：China said it’s uncovered “irrefutable evidence” of US government cyber attacks on the country’s main agency responsible for timekeeping.】

item.title: 澳大利亚总理将与特朗普会晤，重点讨论稀土问题
item.description: 澳大利亚总理安东尼-阿尔巴内塞预计将于周一在华盛顿与美国总统唐纳德-特朗普举行会谈，会谈内容将包括稀土材料供应链的讨论。【原文：Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese is expected to meet US President Donald Trump on Monday in Washington for talks that will include discussions over the supply chain of rare earth materials.】

item.title: 黑船似乎在马来西亚附近海域转移受制裁的俄罗斯液化天然气
item.description: 卫星图像显示，一艘从美国批准的俄罗斯出口工厂运载液化天然气的深色油轮已经就位，准备在马来西亚沿海进行一次罕见的公开水域燃料转运，这表明莫斯科为规避西方限制而采取的路线越来越迂回曲折。【原文：A dark tanker carrying liquefied natural gas from a US-sanctioned Russian export plant has positioned itself for a rare open-water fuel transfer off the coast of Malaysia, satellite images show, in a demonstration of the increasingly circuitous routes taken by Moscow to evade Western restrictions.】

item.title: 泡沫争论促使韩国散户投资者进行高风险的 VIX 赌注
item.description: 韩国投资者希望对其持有的大量美股进行套期保值或下注，他们正在接受一种新型交易：杠杆式 VIX 赌注。【原文：Investors in South Korea looking to hedge their big US stock holdings or play their next wager are embracing a new type of trades: leveraged VIX bets.】

item.title: 中国 2025 年最大政治会议交易指南
item.description: 在投资者权衡美国贸易紧张局势升级带来的风险之际，本周在北京举行的一次关键性政治会议可能会出台新的政策措施，以延续中国股市八年来最强劲的涨势，并支撑人民币。【原文：A pivotal political gathering in Beijing this week could deliver fresh policy measures to extend China’s strongest equity rally in eight years and shore up the yuan, as investors weigh risks from escalating US trade tensions.】

item.title: 美国警告哈马斯 "即将 "袭击巴勒斯坦人
item.description: 美国国务院表示，它已通知加沙和平协议的相关国家，哈马斯正在计划对巴勒斯坦人发动袭击，这将违反停火协议。【原文：The State Department said it informed countries involved in the Gaza peace agreement that an attack by Hamas is being planned against Palestinians and that it would be a violation of the ceasefire deal.】

item.title: 芯片公司艾睿称其产品将从美国黑名单中删除
item.description: 艾睿电子公司（Arrow Electronics Inc.【原文：Arrow Electronics Inc. said its affiliates will be dropped from a US Commerce Department sanctions list, sparing the Colorado-based chip distributor’s subsidiaries from a possible ban on purchases of American technologies.】

item.title: 中国出口繁荣难阻经济放缓
item.description: 尽管出口蓬勃发展，但中国第三季度的经济增长速度可能是一年来最慢的，中国共产党可能会在下周的一次重要会议上纠正这种脱节现象。【原文：China’s economy probably grew at the slowest in a year during the third quarter despite a boom in exports, in a disconnect the Communist Party may move to rectify at a key meeting in the coming week.】

item.title: 黑客自 2023 年起就潜伏在网络公司 F5 系统中
item.description: 据 F5 公司知情人士透露，国家支持的黑客从 2023 年底开始入侵网络安全公司 F5 公司，并潜伏在公司系统中，直到今年 8 月才被发现。【原文：The state-backed hackers who breached cybersecurity company F5 Inc. broke in beginning in late 2023 and lurked in the company’s systems until being discovered in August of this year, according to people who were briefed by F5 about the incident.】

item.title: 私人信贷最受欢迎的基金 BDC 正在接受审查
item.description: 私人信贷最受欢迎的基金结构之一已成为交易员和华尔街高管寻找市场疲软迹象的新战场。【原文：One of private credit’s favorite fund structures has emerged as a new battleground for traders and Wall Street executives looking for signs of weakness in the market.】

item.title: 拉加德称德国现在是欧洲变革的推动者
item.description: 欧洲中央银行行长克里斯蒂娜-拉加德称赞德国终于打开了钱袋子。【原文：European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde praised Germany for finally opening its purse strings.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》称 Kering 正在商谈以 40 亿美元出售美容部门
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》报道，开云集团（Kering SA）正在洽谈将其美容业务出售给欧莱雅集团（L'Oréal SA），交易价值约为 40 亿美元。【原文：Kering SA is in talks to sell its beauty business to L’Oréal SA in a deal worth about $4 billion, according to the Wall Street Journal.】

item.title: 贝利称英国经济将逐渐适应脱欧冲击
item.description: 英国央行行长安德鲁-贝利（Andrew Bailey）表示，英国在 2016 年退出欧盟的决定将在几年内继续拖累英国经济增长，但从长远来看，英国经济将会做出调整。【原文：Britain’s decision to leave the European Union in 2016 will continue to weigh on UK growth for several years, but in the longer term the economy will adjust, Bank of England Governor Andrew Bailey said.】

item.title: 阿联酋 NBD 银行将向印度 RBL 银行投资 30.5 亿美元
item.description: 阿联酋 NBD 银行（Emirates NBD Bank PJSC）将向印度私人贷款机构 RBL 银行有限公司投资多达 30.5 亿美元，这凸显了外国投资者对印度金融业的持续兴趣。【原文：Emirates NBD Bank PJSC will invest as much as $3.05 billion in Indian private lender RBL Bank Ltd., underscoring continued foreign investor interest in India’s financial sector.】

item.title: 银行借贷风险令股市岌岌可危，交易员 "心惊肉跳
item.description: 财报季的开始暴露了股市泡沫基础的潜在裂缝：一些地区性银行的高风险贷款。【原文：The start of earnings season is exposing a potential crack in the stock market’s frothy foundation: risky lending by some regional banks.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长纳格尔称未来几年通胀基本在目标范围内
item.description: 德国央行行长约阿希姆-纳格尔（Joachim Nagel）表示，未来几年欧元区通胀率将可能达到欧洲央行 2% 的目标。【原文：Euro-area inflation will probably meet the European Central Bank’s 2% goal over the coming years, according to Bundesbank President Joachim Nagel said.】

item.title: 印度售罄，伦敦恐慌：白银市场如何崩溃
item.description: 几个月来，Vipin Raina 一直在准备迎接印度顾客为纪念印度教财富女神而大量购买白银。【原文：For months, Vipin Raina had been bracing for a stampede of buying from Indian customers loading up on silver to honor the Hindu goddess of wealth.】

item.title: 倾向中国的政治家赢得台湾反对党国民党领导人选举
item.description: 一位主张与中国加强联系的前台湾立法委员在竞选中胜出，成为台湾最大反对党的领导人。【原文：A former Taiwan lawmaker who has advocated closer ties to China won the contest to become the leader of the island’s biggest opposition party.】

item.title: 保卫阿根廷比索和家园
item.description: 拉里-萨默斯解释美国对拉美货币的干预。【原文：Larry Summers explains US intervention in Latin American currencies.】

item.title: 阿根廷首席执行官在年度务虚会上努力应对米莱波动
item.description: 本周，众多阿根廷商界领袖来到一处海滨度假胜地，试图抛开困扰该国的政治和市场动荡，思考未来。但他们的努力几乎难以为继。【原文：A throng of Argentine business leaders who descended this week on a beach resort tried to leave behind the political and market turmoil gripping the country so they could ponder the future. Their efforts were near impossible to sustain.】

item.title: 引领人工智能浪潮的加密货币矿工将比特币甩在身后
item.description: 随着越来越多的人转向围绕人工智能和高性能计算建立的混合模式，使比特币得以运行的大规模计算设备的股价再次超过了最初的加密货币。【原文：Shares of the large-scale computing outfits that make Bitcoin work are once again outperforming the original cryptocurrency, as more pivot to hybrid models built around artificial intelligence and high-performance computing.】

item.title: 期待已久的石油盈余随十亿桶船队而来
item.description: 观察全球石油市场变化的最佳地点是海上。【原文：The best place to observe the shift taking place in global oil markets is at sea.】

item.title: 重商主义政策手册正在走向全球
item.description: "当你面对像中国这样的非市场经济国家时，你就必须实施产业政策"。【原文：“When you are facing a non-market economy like China, then you have to exercise industrial policies.”】

item.title: 贷款增长强劲，ICICI 银行利润超出预期
item.description: 印度第二大私人银行 ICICI Bank Ltd. 的利润超过预期，因为在强劲的零售需求推动下，该银行的贷款实现了健康增长。【原文：ICICI Bank Ltd.’s profit beat estimates as India’s second-largest private lender reported a healthy growth in loans, fueled by strong retail demand.】

item.title: 英国《金融时报》称，英国财政大臣考虑全面改革 ISA 股票所有权
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》报道，英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）正在考虑改革免税个人储蓄账户的规则，以增加英国的股票持有量。【原文：Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves is considering reforming rules on tax-free individual savings accounts to increase UK share ownership, the Financial Times reported.】

item.title: 贷款增长强劲，HDFC 银行利润超预期
item.description: 印度最大的私营贷款机构 HDFC 银行有限公司公布的第二季度利润超过预期，贷款增长健康。【原文：HDFC Bank Ltd., India’s largest private sector lender, posted second-quarter profit that beat estimates amid healthy growth in loans.】

item.title: 全球经济图表：黄金在中美紧张局势中飙升
item.description: 在世界主要经济体之间贸易关系再度紧张的背景下，黄金和白银本周继续反弹，尽管周五出现了暴跌。【原文：Gold and silver continued to rally this week, despite a Friday tumble, amid renewed trade tensions between the world’s top economies.】

item.title: 瑞典 Stegra 在 Northvolt 的回声中面临资金紧张问题
item.description: 低碳钢初创公司 Stegra AB 本应成为瑞典绿色工业雄心的倡导者。现在，该公司面临资金紧张，正在寻求高达 9.75 亿欧元（约合 11.4 亿美元）的新融资，以支付高于预期的项目成本、为基础设施提供资金，并填补因国家拨款支持延迟而留下的缺口。【原文：Low-carbon steel startup Stegra AB was supposed to be a champion of Sweden’s green industrial ambitions. Now the company faces a funding crunch, and is seeking up to €975 million ($1.14 billion) in new financing to cover higher than expected project costs, fund infrastructure and fill a gap left by delays to state grant support.】

item.title: 莱斯库雷说，法国评级一年内第三次被下调是对加强努力的呼唤
item.description: 法国财政部长罗兰-莱斯库雷（Roland Lescure）表示，法国不能忽视不到一年内的第三次信用评级下调。【原文：France can’t afford to ignore the third credit-rating reduction in less than a year, according to French Finance Minister Roland Lescure.】
